columns.name: TenantId
columns.description: ID of the workspace that stores this record

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: Type of agent the data was collected from. For syslog the value is typically Linux.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Date and time the record was created.

columns.name: MG
columns.description: ID of the management group for System Center Operations Manager agents.

columns.name: Computer
columns.description: Computer from which the event originated.

columns.name: EventTime
columns.description: Date and time that the event was generated.

columns.name: Facility
columns.description: The part of the system that generated the message.

columns.name: HostName
columns.description: Name of the system from which the message originated.

columns.name: ProcessID
columns.description: ID of the process that generated the message.

columns.name: HostIP
columns.description: IP address of the system from which the message originated. Depending on network configuration/topology, this may have a blank or placeholder value, especially when the message originates from a remote device.

columns.name: ProcessName
columns.description: Name of the process that generated the message.

columns.name: CollectorHostName
columns.description: Name of the system on which the collector agent is installed.
